result.execSummary:
The defendant Skylar D. Sayre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Skylar D. Sayre is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Skylar D. Sayre was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
The Department shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Arellano.  Arguments heard on deft's bond reduction motion.  State takes no position.  Court grants the deft's bond motion; bond is reduced to $5,000 cash.  Same conditions apply.

Def. has retained Atty. Joshua Uller

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Josh Uller. Clerk LE. Atty. Kristyne Watson relieved of further duty, as def. has retained private counsel. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Krejcarek. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KSD Dep. Sean Beckstrom sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Uller. KSD Deputy Justin McCoy sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Uller. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3 for arraignment on 10-3-14 @ 9:10am. Information filed. Bond continued.

238 p.m.  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Benitez-Morgan.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 9/9/14 @ 10:15 a.m.  Atty Benitez-Morgan moves to dismiss Ct 2 - Court denies motion.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
